thread.title: The Goring gourmet break

author: The Telegraph
title: The Goring gourmet break
text: This year, The Goring not only celebrated its 105th birthday, but completed renovations which took five years. Located opposite Buckingham Palace, it’s been a favourite among the great and good, from the Queen Mother to the Duchess of Cambridge, the latter of whom spent the night before her wedding at the hotel. A special package has been created for Telegraph readers, who, as part of their package, will receive a three-course dinner with carefully selection wines in The Goring’s Dining Room. From £295pp, based on two people sharing a King room. For more details and to book please visit: telegraph.co.uk/thegoringoffer Our expert says: “Stylish redecoration has finished with the unveiling of its ravishing new Front Hall, clad with hand-painted wallpaper of exotic animals (some caricatures of staff and owners) in a romantic English landscape.” What’s included : •A glass of Champagne on arrival •Full English or continental breakfast and a complimentary copy of The Daily Telegraph •King Room for two people, which has a six-foot, king-size bed •Three-course dinner with carefully chosen wines in The Goring’s Dining Room • Read the full review: The Goring, London Telegraphtravel Follow @telegraphtravel
